intro: Clidemia fallax, commonly known as the Hawaiian strewer, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. It is an important species in the native flora of Hawaii and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
